    • Method Detail

      • dispose

        public void dispose()
        Dispose all the resources of this object. This method will unregister this object from the ticker and any event handlers and check/save all the remaining BlockData left in the cache. This method will block until saving is complete and the cache has been cleared.

      • loadConfig

        public void loadConfig()

      • getHistory

        public List<BlockData> getHistory(Player player,
                         Date date)
        Get the ClassicBlock Change history of a player with the first element being the current time and the last element being the block change that occurred on the date specified in the parameter date
        Parameters:
        player - The player to get the data
        date - The lowest date
        Returns:
        The block history in an unmodifiable list with the first date being the one specified in the parameter

      • getHistory

        public List<BlockData> getHistory(Player player,
                         int seconds)
        Get the block change history of a player with the first element being the current time and the last element being current time - seconds (where seconds is specified in the parameter).
        Parameters:
        player - The player to get the data for
        seconds - The amount of seconds to subtract from the current date
        Returns:
        The block history in an unmodifiable list with the last element being the (current time - the seconds specified in the parameter)
        See Also:
        Date.Date()

      • getHistory

        public List<BlockData> getHistory(Player player,
                         long milliseconds)
        Get the block change history of a player ending with the lowest value being the millisecond specified in the parameter milliseconds
        Parameters:
        player - The player to get the data for
        milliseconds - The lowest time in milliseconds
        Returns:

      • getOfflineHistory

        public List<BlockData> getOfflineHistory(String player,
                                Date date)
        Get the ClassicBlock Change history of a player that is offline. With the first element being the current time and the last element being the block change that occurred on the date specified in the parameter date
        Parameters:
        player - The player to get the data
        date - The lowest date
        Returns:
        The block history in an unmodifiable list with the first date being the one specified in the parameter

      • getOfflineHistory

        public List<BlockData> getOfflineHistory(String player,
                                int seconds)
        Get the block change history of a player that is offline With the first element being the current time and the last element being current time - seconds (where seconds is specified in the parameter).
        Parameters:
        player - The player to get the data for
        seconds - The amount of seconds to subtract from the current date
        Returns:
        The block history in an unmodifiable list with the last element being the (current time - the seconds specified in the parameter)
        See Also:
        Date.Date()

      • getOfflineHistory

                                long milliseconds)

        Parameters:

      • tick

        public void tick()
        Description copied from interface: Tick
        This is called whenever the system ticks. You should handle any unhandled exceptions in this method, if to many exceptions are raised in this tick, then it will be removed from the system tick.
        Specified by:
        tick in interface Tick

      • inSeperateThread

        public boolean inSeperateThread()
        Description copied from interface: Tick
        Weather or not to run this tick object in a separate thread
        Specified by:
        inSeperateThread in interface Tick
        Returns:
        returns true if it will run in a separate thread, otherwise it will return false.

      • getTimeout

        public int getTimeout()
        Description copied from interface: Tick
        How many milliseconds each tick is separated by, where 1000 is 1 second and 60000 is 1 minute.
        Specified by:
        getTimeout in interface Tick
        Returns:
        The amount of milliseconds to wait before calling the Tick.tick() method again.

      • tickName

        public String tickName()
        Description copied from interface: Tick
        Get the name of this tick. This will be the name will appear in exception stackTraces when an unhandled exception occurs. The name of the current thread will also be renamed to this by calling Thread.setName(String)
        Specified by:
        tickName in interface Tick
        Returns:
